statement.tex: %text Show that the four points $A, B, C$ and $D$ whose position vectors are $\vector{4}{5}{1}$, $\vector{}{-}{-}$, $\vector{3}{9}{4}$ and $4(\vector{-}{1}{1})$ respectively, are coplanar. %

reason.tex: %text If $\ora{AB}\times \ora{AC}=\ora{P}$, then $\ora{P}$ is $\perp$ to the plane containing $A$, $B$ and $C$. If $D$ is also in the same plane, then $\ora{AD}\perp \ora{P}$ and therefore $\ora{AD}\cdot\ora{P}=0$. %

%text Using determinant expansion along the first row, % \begin{align} &\left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} -4 & -6 & -2 \\ -1 & 4 & 3 \\ -8 & -1 & 3 \end{array}\right\vert \\ =&-4(4\cdot 3+1\cdot3){\bf +6}(-1\cdot 3+8\cdot 3)-2(1+8\cdot 4) \\ =&-60+126-66=0 \end{align}
